title: SR-SAVI Conference
text:
Day 1 (October 17th)
Session 1: Translational Research Bridging Animal Studies to Human Applications and Policy Implementation
8:30-9: Welcome & Registration
9-9:30 Keynote by Dr Benjamin Ineichen
9:30-10:30 Presentations (15 minutes)

Friederike Elisabeth Kohrs: Communities for Open Research Synthesis – accelerating the translation of evidence by integrating preclinical systematic reviews into the research pipeline
Carolyne Huang: A simulation study to quantify successful translation of results from preclinical studies to human trials
Joelle Jagersma: Animal models for the social, cognitive, and neurobiological impact of early-onset hearing loss: a systematic review with synthesis without meta-analysis (SWiM)
Charis Wong: Selecting amantadine as the 3rd experimental arm for MND-SMART using a data-driven framework

10:30-11: Coffee break
Session 2: Promoting Rigour and Transparency in Systematic Reviews
11-11:30: Keynote by Dr David Moher
11:30-12:30 Presentations (15 minutes)

Alexandra Bannach-Brown: Barriers and enablers to conducting systematic reviews at a German University Medical Center – Findings from the “Communities for Open Research Synthesis” project
Aileen MacLellan: Assessing scientific rigour and 3Rs implementation in Canadian research: An investigation of animal use protocols
Martijn Nolte: Better Science through More Transparency: Pilot study on stimulating transparent laboratory animal research
Kimberley Wever: Building on Success: a Roadmap for High-Quality In Vitro Systematic Reviews by Transferring Expertise from Animal Systematic Review Methodology

12:30-13:30: Lunch break
13:30-16:00: Reproducibility Challenge, held by Dr Kimberley Wever and Dr Sarah McCann
17 onwards: Social event


Day 2 (October 18th)
Session 3: Identification and Management of Questionable Research Practices and Potential Research Misconduct
9-9:30 Keynote by Dr Elisabeth Bik
9:30-10:15 Presentations (15 minutes)

Kimberley Wever: Uncovering Duplicated Images in Scientific Literature - Systematic Review as a Tool for Detection
Otto Kalliokoski: It is time to talk about fraudulent studies in meta-analytical evidence synthesis – learnings from a preclinical systematic review
Sara Steele: Underreporting in non-clinical publications: Development of the rigor assessment tool (RAT)

10:15-10:45: Coffee break
Session 4: The integration of Automation and AI in Systematic Reviews and Meta-analyses
10:45-11:15: Keynote by Dr Sophia Ananiadou
11:15 - 11:55: Presentations (10 minutes)

Kaitlyn Hair: The future of Systematic Online Living Evidence Summaries (SOLES): emerging trends and challenges in automating evidence synthesis
Andrew Rooney: Improving workflow for evidence-based decision making in environmental health evaluations
Francesca Tinsdeall: A Comprehensive Evaluation of Stopping Rules in Technology-Assisted Review: When Have We Screened Enough?
Pu Yiyuan: Large Language Models in systematic review automation of Alzheimer’s research: enhancing living evidence landscape with PICO entity extraction

12:05: - 12:35: Panel discussion with speakers and keynote
12:35-14: Lunch break
14-15:30: Poster session
15:30-16: Closing & Ackowledgements: Benjamin Ineichen and organizers

title: Speakers List
text:
Elisabeth Bik





Elisabeth Margaretha Harbers-Bik is a Dutch microbiologist and scientific integrity consultant. Bik is known for her work detecting photo manipulation in scientific publications, and identifying over 4,000 potential cases of improper research conduct





# Define a data frame with speaker details
speakers <- data.frame(
  name = c("Elisabeth Bik", "John Doe", "Jane Smith"),
  bio = c(
    "Elisabeth Margaretha Harbers-Bik is a Dutch microbiologist and scientific integrity consultant.",
    "John Doe is a fictional character often used to represent an anonymous person.",
    "Jane Smith is a well-known author and educator."
  ),
  image = c("Bik.png", "john_doe.png", "jane_smith.png"),
  stringsAsFactors = FALSE
)


# Loop through each speaker
text<-for (i in 1:nrow(speakers)) {
  paste("::: {.callout-caution collapse=\"true\" icon=\"false\" appearance=\"minimal\"}\n","</br>",
  "###", speakers$name[i], "</br>",
  speakers$bio[i], "</br>",
  "![](", speakers$image[i], "){width=200px}\n\n")
}

text

NULL
